H0.text: The melody for which famous song was written by sisters and school teachers Patty and Mildred Hill in Kentucky in 1893. Goodnight to You

H1.text: The melody for which famous song was written by sisters and school teachers Patty and Mildred Hill in Kentucky in 1893. School Days

H2.text: The melody for which famous song was written by sisters and school teachers Patty and Mildred Hill in Kentucky in 1893. Kentucky Home

H3.text: The melody for which famous song was written by sisters and school teachers Patty and Mildred Hill in Kentucky in 1893. Hapy birthday

A4.text: The Hill sisters were credited as co-writing the tune to the song 'Good Morning to All', which became even more popular as 'Happy Birthday to You' during the 20th century.

A5.text: The song was first published in 1893 in Song Stories for the Kindergarten as a greeting song for teachers to sing to their students.

A6.text: While teaching at the Louisville Experimental Kindergarten School, the Hill sisters wrote the song 'Good Morning to All'; Mildred wrote the melody, and Patty the lyrics.
